Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is grey-black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394178) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394178)
